RECIPE.NAME: Super quick Pitta Pizzas
RECIPE.COPY: A quick and easy, healthy pizza recipe! Helps combat polycystic ovary syndrome in girls, while boys will benefit from a healthier meal than the fat-drenched fast-food alternative.

RECIPE.NAME: Low GI Spaghetti Bolognese
RECIPE.COPY: Spaghetti Bolognese in under 10 minutes? Your mum will be so proud. This low-GI recipe includes ingredients that will help combat a fatty liver.

RECIPE.NAME: Home-made re-hydration drink
RECIPE.COPY: This is a home-made rehydration and can be used after sports, or if you had a funny tummy. More nutrients, less processed powder and chemicals. Everyone is a winner in under two minutes.

RECIPE.NAME: Spinach Salad with sumac, tomatoes and feta
RECIPE.COPY: Buy it, rinse it, chop it, toss it, heat it, serve it, eat it. This unusual and flavoursome salad helps combat acid reflux.

RECIPE.NAME: Super Smoothie
RECIPE.COPY: Smoothies are so versatile, almost any non-citrus fruit will work well with this recipe. Try adding a handful of oats or nuts for added protein and a more substantial breakfast or pick-me-up. In the summer add a couple of blocks of ice for a super refreshing smoothie.

RECIPE.NAME: Jerk Chicken with rice and peas
RECIPE.COPY: A simple meal that feeds a family, covering all the major food groups along the way, and helps combat high cholesterol.

RECIPE.NAME: Homemade pitta chips with guacamole, hummus and salsa
RECIPE.COPY: Serve in three little bowls and dip dip dip! Helps combat asthma.

RECIPE.NAME: Cod with roasted winter veggies
RECIPE.COPY: This fish dish is quick to prep, yet healthy as can be: high in oily fish, low in fat its ingredients help combat diabetes.

RECIPE.NAME: Quickest mint and courgette pasta
RECIPE.COPY: This is a no cook pasta sauce, perfect for a super quick dinner or lunch. This dish is all about the balance of acidity from the lemon, sweet sharpness from the parmesan, depth from the oil and good seasoning to bring it all together, so taste and adjust until it tastes amazing. Don’t use the pre-grated parmesan for this - buy a block and grate it yourself.

RECIPE.NAME: Super fragrant soya coconut curry
RECIPE.COPY: This curry uses two types of soya, edamame beans and tofu so for those trying to up their soy intake this is a brilliant dish. It’s super tasty for anyone else though and a welcome, lighter change to the usual chicken tikka masala.
